title: 111_s279
content: The "Municipal Bond Market Support Act of 2009" is the short title of the Act. It includes a modification of the small issuer exception to tax-exempt interest expense allocation rules for financial institutions. The "Municipal Bond Market Support Act of 2009" modifies the small issuer exception to tax-exempt interest expense allocation rules for financial institutions. It increases the limitation from $10,000,000 to $30,000,000 and repeals aggregation rules for small issuer determination. Additionally, it allows an election to apply the limitation at the borrower level. The "Municipal Bond Market Support Act of 2009" increases the small issuer exception to tax-exempt interest expense allocation rules from $10,000,000 to $30,000,000. It repeals aggregation rules for small issuer determination and allows an election to apply the limitation at the borrower level. Eligible loans are defined as loans to qualified borrowers with outstanding balances not exceeding $30,000,000. Qualified borrowers are organizations described in section 501(c)(3). The "Municipal Bond Market Support Act of 2009" increases the small issuer exception to tax-exempt interest expense allocation rules from $10,000,000 to $30,000,000. It repeals aggregation rules for small issuer determination and allows an election to apply the limitation at the borrower level. Eligible loans are defined as loans to qualified borrowers with outstanding balances not exceeding $30,000,000, who are organizations described in section 501(c)(3). The election for the issuer to make this choice can be done at any time before issuing obligations for eligible loans. The "Municipal Bond Market Support Act of 2009" increases the small issuer exception to tax-exempt interest expense allocation rules from $10,000,000 to $30,000,000, with inflation adjustments applied annually. The amendments made by this section apply to obligations issued after December 31, 2008. The De Minimis Safe Harbor Exception for tax-exempt interest expense of financial institutions and brokers is outlined in Section 3. The De Minimis Safe Harbor Exception for tax-exempt obligations issued during 2009 or 2010 is outlined in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 for financial institutions and brokers. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 introduces a De Minimis Exception for tax-exempt bonds issued in 2009 or 2010, limiting the amount not considered for brokers to 2 percent of their assets. These amendments apply to obligations issued after December 31, 2008.
